9661aab027f8.title: Any reason why you don’t just use @click.native

virtuals.subtitle: Alternatively if you the component was to $emit(‘click’) itself you could then remove the .native part.

paragraphs.name: 2dc0
paragraphs.text: Any reason why you don’t just use @click.native on the component rather than passing a function as a prop?
Alternatively if you the component was to $emit(‘click’) itself you could then remove the .native part.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for reading and responding, I appreciate it! virtuals.subtitle: I usually go for something like `UIButton` to make the distinction clear ;)

paragraphs.name: c492
paragraphs.text: I'm fairly certain that Vue warns against creating components with the same name as native HTML elements, like `header` and `button`, unless you assign them a different id in the `components`property. Maybe it would be better for the sake of the article to rename those element instead.
